intro: Sunaptea lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf sunaptea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
